application_instruction:
This role may also be located in our Playa Vista, CA campus.

Note: By applying to this position your application is automatically submitted to the following locations: San Bruno, CA, USA; Los Angeles, CA, USA
description:
The YouTube Strategy team focuses on our highest priorities, solving complex, ambiguous problems that span early stage growth initiatives, investing in our largest product or business areas, making major operational or organizational changes, and assessing strategic rationale for YouTube external investment opportunities. Throughout, we provide analytics-based insights, ensure cross-functional alignment of goals and execution, help YouTube teams drive our most important strategic initiatives, and advise our senior leadership on the best path forward.

The YouTube team helps budding creators build careers, engaging communities around shared passions and global conversations. The YouTube Strategy Organization provides business critical insights using analytics, ensures cross functional alignment of goals and execution, and helps teams drive strategic partnerships and new initiatives forward.

As an Industry and Competitive Insights Principal, you will perform a broad range of research tasks, including collecting behavior and market information, developing and codifying knowledge on new, emerging, and analyzing and synthesizing findings into written memos, numerical analyses/models, and/or presentations.

In this role, you will work with Google Corporate Development to source and execute growth opportunities through partnership and new engagements, seeking out potential goals and highlighting any opportunities to relevant stakeholders. Additionally, you will develop, maintain, and communicate insights about the video, technology, and media industry globally, including competitive and product trends and partnership opportunities.

At YouTube, we believe that everyone deserves to have a voice, and that the world is a better place when we listen, share, and build community through our stories. We work together to give everyone the power to share their story, explore what they love, and connect with one another in the process. Working at the intersection of cutting-edge technology and boundless creativity, we move at the speed of culture with a shared goal to show people the world. We explore new ideas, solve real problems, and have fun — and we do it all together.

qualifications:
Minimum qualifications:

  • Bachelor's degree or equivalent practical experience.
  • 7 years of experience in business research within digital media, consulting, investment banking, or a business research company.

Preferred qualifications:

  • MBA or equivalent practical experience in consulting or investment banking.
  • Experience researching and tracking market trends and/or competitive dynamics and codifying and managing this knowledge effectively, developing chart-based slides and turning data into insights.
  • Experience managing research vendors. Experience in financial modeling and forecasting using spreadsheet software and SQL.
  • Experience in mergers and/or investments from a role in investment banking, private equity, or corporate development.
  • Understanding of trends, competitive landscapes, and key players in the global video and media industry.
  • Ability to multi-task and operate effectively in fast-paced and ambiguous situations. Excellent analytical skills.
responsibilities:
• Maintain key competitive and industry dashboards including detailed briefs on specific markets and/or competitors or trends. Serve as a centralized source for third-party data sources across YouTube.
  • Develop executive-level viewpoints on environment, trends, and opportunities related to the video, technology, and media industry globally and in key markets.
  • Conduct ad-hoc research for YouTube Strategy projects, providing relevant background material, using internal and external data sources, and turning information into insights by preparing accurate, well-developed analyses, reports, and documents.
  • Structure, launch, and drive industry and competitive strategy projects by developing hypotheses, translating these hypotheses into work plans, leading Strategy team members and cross-functional teams to conduct analysis and research.
  • Develop contacts with investment bankers and venture capitalists to source ideas, working with Google Corporate Development team to negotiate and execute agreements.
title: Industry and Competitive Insights Principal
